summary: This document is a detailed investigative report from the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) examining the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details his arrest, psychological assessments, suicide watch protocols, the failure to reassign a cellmate after his previous one was transferred, and the subsequent failure of correctional staff to conduct mandatory counts and rounds on the night of August 9-10, 2019, leading to his death by suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure, incarcerated at MCC New York on federal sex trafficking charges. The report details his psychological assessments, housing assignments, and his death by suicide on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Formally Charged
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was formally charged with Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking.

events.title: Epstein Arrested
events.description: FBI arrested Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey upon his return from Paris, France.

events.title: First Suicide Attempt in SHU
events.description: Epstein was found with an 'orange homemade rope' around his neck in his SHU cell. An investigation was inconclusive on whether it was self-harm or an assault.

events.title: Cellmate Transferred, Documents Unsealed
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was permanently transferred out of MCC. Approximately 2,000 pages of court documents were unsealed, naming Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and other high-profile figures.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Epstein was found unresponsive in his SHU cell with a noose around his neck. He was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

keyFacts: Epstein was required by psychology staff to have a cellmate at all times after being taken off psychological observation on July 30, 2019.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate was permanently transferred out of MCC. Despite multiple staff being aware of the cellmate requirement and the transfer, no new cellmate was assigned to Epstein.

Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to falsifying all institutional count slips and 30-minute round sheets for the SHU between 4 p.m. on August 9 and 5 a.m. on August 10, 2019. They did not conduct any of the mandatory checks.

Epstein was found deceased in his single-occupancy cell on the morning of August 10, 2019. The report concludes staff failures in assigning a cellmate and conducting counts/rounds contributed to the opportunity for his suicide.
The report notes systemic issues at MCC including understaffing, poor record-keeping in the SENTRY system, and a lack of checks and balances to ensure inmates were in their assigned cells.
